column4: Hey ppl i've installed ubuntu 8.04...but whenever  i try to set the resolution above 800*600,the screen becomesw unstable,even though my drivers and hardwares are perfectly compactable in running these settings...any idea why???
what is the output of: lspci | grep -i vga
right now,m on my friends comp....and am kinda a beginner,so anything will be helpful...???
i gave the command you need to run in a terminal

i'll definately try that. can u tell me the reason though....why i can run the windows perfectly well, but the screen starts flickering like crazy...and the system has 2 be shut down...plz hlp,can't access the system right now!
you havent configured drivers yet as its a clean install
none of my systems go above 640x480 without drivers
and what windows does or doesnt do i moot
: do the drivers have to be installed seperately after installing ubuntu,i thought they came preloaded?
with some cards yes, with some no
once you run the command you will know the video card and you can websearch to find guides
: okay.....thanks a lot,i think i get it now!
if its nvidia you are laughig
: btw,i have an iso image of ubuntu 9.10, how can ii update my current 8.04 without having to uninstall the entire od?
you will need the 9.04 alternate CD as well as the 9.10 alternate CD. You cannot upgrade direct to 9.10 and you cannot upgrade with the desktop ISO
or you can upgrade using the web
: and how can i uninstall the 8.04,without the help of windows, i installed it from a bootable cd..
